This manual explains how to use Install and Remove Applications, an application that enables users to easily add and remove software for the GNOME desktop created by the Ubuntu project.
Introduction
Install and Remove Applications allows you to add or remove applications with a click of a button. You can browse through the categories to find applications or search through all of the applications using the search box.
Only simple additions and removals can be performed with Install and Remove Applications. For more advanced needs, the Synaptic Package Manager is used.
Getting Started
Installation
Install and Remove Applications is configured as part of the Ubuntu desktop, and should already be in your system if you did a standard install. If Install and Remove Applications is not installed, you can use the Synaptic Package Manager to add it. From your desktop select
System Administration Synaptic Package Manager to start Synaptic. The package you need to install is gnome-app-install.
You may also install and set up Install and Remove Applications from the command line using apt-get:
sudo apt-get install gnome-app-install
Install and Remove Applications is dependent on the following packages:
gconf2
python
synaptic
python-gtk2
python-gnome2-extras
python-glade2
python-gnome2
python-apt
python-xdg
gnome-icon-theme
python-launchpad-integration
firefox
update-manager
app-install-data
Starting Install and Remove Applications
There are two ways to start Install and Remove Applications:
From your desktop select
Applications Add/Remove... to start Install and Remove Applications.
Install and Remove Applications can also be invoked from the command line:
gnome-app-install
When the application is loaded, it will check for installed and available applications. After the check process you can manage the software on your system.
Main Window
When you start Install and Remove Applications, the following window is displayed.
Install and Remove Applications main window
The main window of consists of the following:
Software catalog column - displays the categories of software that are available.
Applications panel - shows the software available from the category chosen from the software catalog column.
Search field - you can search for a specific software from a chosen category.
Extra applications checkbox - you can filter the results of your search by selecting or deselecting these checkboxes.
Application description panel - a brief description of the application to be installed or removed is displayed here.
Help button - displays this help page.
Advanced button - opens up the Synaptic Package Manager for advanced installation and removal of software.
Action buttons - you can apply or cancel changes with these buttons. You can also close the application by clicking the ok button.
Managing Applications
Searching for applications to install or remove
The first thing to do before installing or removing an application using Install and Remove Applications is to locate for it from the software catalog. To start a search from the software catalog, you can do the following:
Select a category from the software catalog column. The category All consists of all the software available in the catalog.
Type the name of the application you need in the search field.
When you find the application you need, click on the checkbox beside the name of the application in the applications pane.
You can also search for unsupported and commercial applications (they are part of the universe and multiverse components of the Ubuntu software channel). Make sure Show unsupported applications and Show commercial applications are checked.
Use the search field to search for applications to be installed or removed.
Installing new applications
To install an application, check the corresponding application in the application pane. If it is not listed there, follow the steps as enumerated in .
Once you have checked an application to be installed, click Apply to start the installation. A dialog will appear that shows the applications that will be added to or removed from your system.
List of applications to be added after selecting and applying them from the main window
To confirm the installation, click Apply. The software will then be downloaded and installed. If you wish to go back to the main window or cancel the installation, click Cancel.
Downloading package files
The downloaded package will then be installed. To have the progress dialog close after installation, select Automatically close after the changes have been successfully applied. You can also check the progress of the installation from a terminal output by maximizing the Terminal option.
Installing software
When installation is done, a dialog containing a list of all newly installed applications will appear. You can double-click on an icon to launch it from here or you can close this dialog to finish the installation.
New applications installed
Removing applications from the system
To remove an application, uncheck the corresponding application in the application pane. If it is not listed there, follow the steps as enumerated in .
Once you have selected an application to be removed, click Apply to start the process. A dialog will show the applications that will be removed from your system. To continue removing the application, click Apply. To cancel the removal, click Cancel.
List of applications to be removed after selecting and applying them from the main window
Once the removal of the application is confirmed, Install and Remove Applications will start de-installing the application from the system. Once it is done, you can now close the dialog and you will be sent back to the main window.
Removing software
